Methods

cleanUp(optionsopt)

Lists and optionally deletes the unused data from file-system based Blob-storage.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
options object <optional>
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
del bool <optional>
 false If true will do the deletion.
env string <optional>
 If given it will set the NODE_ENV environment variable.
input string <optional>
 Input JSON array file, that contains MetaDataHashes that needs to be removed.
Source:
  • src/bin/blob_fs_clean_up.js, line 272

cleanUp(optionsopt)

Lists and optionally deletes the projects matching the criteria.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
options object <optional>
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
del bool <optional>
 false If true will do the deletion.
list bool <optional>
 false If true will list all the projects the owner has rights too.
username string <optional>
 gmeConfig.authentication.guestAccount User.
daysAgo string <optional>
 10 Time since last viewed (inclusive).
commits string <optional>
 1 Maximum number of commits a deleted project can have..
branches string <optional>
 1 Maximum number of branches a deleted project can have.
regex string <optional>
 '.*' Project names must match the regex.
Source:
  • src/bin/clean_up.js, line 24

getProjectJson(project, parameters, callback)

Extracts a serializable json representation of a project tree. To specify starting point set one of the four options. If more than one is set the order of precedence is: branchName, commitHash, tagName and rootHash.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
project ProjectInterface
parameters object Specifies which project tree should be serialized:
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
rootHash string <optional>
 The hash of the tree root.
commitHash string <optional>
 The tree associated with the commitHash.
tagName string <optional>
 The tree at the given tag.
branchName string <optional>
 The tree at the given branch.
callback function
Source:
  • src/common/storage/util.js, line 234

initialize(middlewareOpts)

Called when the server is created but before it starts to listening to incoming requests. N.B. gmeAuth, safeStorage and workerManager are not ready to use until the start function is called. (However inside an incoming request they are all ensured to have been initialized.)
Parameters:
Name Type Description
middlewareOpts object Passed by the webgme server.
Properties
Name Type Description
gmeConfig GmeConfig GME config parameters.
logger GmeLogger logger
ensureAuthenticated function Ensures the user is authenticated.
getUserId function If authenticated retrieves the userId from the request.
gmeAuth object Authorization module.
safeStorage object Accesses the storage and emits events (PROJECT_CREATED, COMMIT..).
workerManager object Spawns and keeps track of "worker" sub-processes.
Source:
  • src/server/middleware/ExampleRestRouter.js, line 30

insertProjectJson(project, optionsopt, callback)

Inserts a serialized project tree into the storage and associates it with a commitHash.

GmeLogger

Describes common API for loggers on both client and server side.
Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Description
debug function Logs debug message.
info function Logs info message.
warn function Logs warn message.
error function Logs error message.
fork function Creates a new logger with the same settings and a name that is an augmentation of this logger and the provided string. If the second argument is true - the provided name will be used as is.
Source:
  • jsdocdefs.js, line 45
